question: Let A = {2, 3, 4, 5, ...... 16, 17, 18}.

Let R be the relation on the set A of ordered pairs of positive integers defined by (a, b) <katex>$R(c,d)$</katex> if and only if <katex>$ad=bc$</katex> for all (a, b), (c, d) in <katex>$A\times A$</katex> Then the number of ordered pairs of the equivalence class of (3, 2) is
explanation: We want pairs <katex>$(x,y) \in A \times A$</katex> such that <katex>$\frac{x}{y} = \frac{3}{2}$</katex>.
